New Records: Giannis Antetokounmpo became Milwaukee's career leader in offensive rebounds with 1,469
Key Match Events: Damian Lillard scored 34 points, Giannis Antetokounmpo had 31 points and 16 rebounds, Bucks took a 17-1 run late in the third quarter
Antetokounmpo picked up his fourth foul with 10:26 left in the third quarter but didn't pick up another foul during that stretch
Pre-Game Insights: Milwaukee coach Doc Rivers shuffled his lineup by giving Andre Jackson Jr. his first start of the season and moving Gary Trent Jr. to a bench role
Post-Match Reflections: The Bucks snapped a six-game skid, avoiding their first seven-game skid since March 2014
Miscellaneous Highlights: Utah led 71-70 before the Bucks took command
The Jazz went 14 of 26 from beyond the arc in the first half to lead 61-57 at the break
Utah led 61-60 when Antetokounmpo picked up his fourth foul
The Bucks are at New York on Friday night
The Jazz are at Sacramento on Saturday
Others: Marques Johnson, now part of the Bucks' television broadcast team, had 1,468 offensive rebounds with the Bucks from 1977-84
